greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = floor(1/((n*r) mod 1)), where r = phi^(-2) = (3 - sqrt(5))/2.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
example: a(6) = 3. Take 6*r = 2.29179...( mod 1) = 0.29179...; invert = 3.42705... and delete the fractional part, getting 3.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 11 2003
